paper_abstract: The Ate pairing has been suggested since it can be computed efficiently on ordinary elliptic curves with small values of the traces of Frobenius t. However, not all pairing-friendly elliptic curves have this property. In this paper, we generalize the Ate pairing and find a series of the variations of the Ate pairing. We show that the shortest Miller loop of the variations of the Ate pairing can possibly be as small as r(1/phi(k)) on some special pairing-friendly curves with large values of Frobenius trace, and hence speed up the pairing computation significantly.
paper_title: A note on the Ate pairing
